channel.title: Pwn on leo_something
channel.description: Recent content in Pwn on leo_something

item.title: HTB Cyber Apocalypse 2025 - Vault
item.description: Hardest pwn challenge of the CTF. A simple vulnerability lead to a BOF, but the path to RCE was really interesting

item.title: TeamItalyCTF 2022 - FamilyRecipes
item.description: This is one of the first heap related kernel challenges I solved, so this writeup could be inaccurate in some spots.

item.title: Srdnlen 2025 - Snowstorm
item.description: Interesting pwn challenge regarding the exploitation of a simple stack BOF.

item.title: Srdnlen 2025 - Kinderheim 511
item.description: Heap challenge with the goal of achieving arbitrary write to read the flag from the heap.

item.title: Kpwn tecniques: modprobe_path
item.description: modprobe_path is a global variable that in most kernels is RW. This variable is contains a path to an executable, do you see where this is going..?

item.title: Kpwn tecniques: struct msg_msg
item.description: msg_msg is a really powerful and elastic kernel struct that can be abused to obtain strong primitives, such as arbitrary read/write/free.

item.title: CTE24 - DiDUP
item.description: This is an hard pwn challenge I wrote for Compete Against TeamEurope, this CTF was part of the training for ECSC2024. The vulnerability is a double-free triggerable through a race condition. No bruteforce is needed.

item.title: UIUCTF24 - Pwnymalloc
item.description: Pwnymalloc is a nice custom allocator challenge from UIUCTF 2024. The vulnerability was about an incorrect handling of the prev_size during consolitation.

item.title: Ret2dlresolve in 64bit binaries
item.description: Ret2dlresolve is a really powerful tecnique to use in pwn challenges (even tho it’s not frequently seen). It’s useful when we don’t have libc leaks or don’t know the libc version.

item.title: CodegateJunior24 - Baby Heap
item.description: Heap challenge from the Codegate quals for juniors of 2024. The vulnerability was an heap overflow that enabled an attacker to gain overlapping chunks, therefore arb read and write.

item.title: OpenECSC Round 3 - Log4x86
item.description: This challenge comes from the 3rd round of openECSC 2024. The challenge was really really interesting: the exploitation tecnique involved a buffer overflow through a really short format string vulnerability.
